Note that $2p(1-p)$ is simply the heterozygosity in the population. As expected, the additive genetic variance (which is simply the genetic variance in this additive model of course) increases with increased variance in allele frequencies, that is increased heterozygosity.

This is readily extended to the multilocus bi-allelic case.
